item.title: Tree cut ! Why??? 60cm of the tronc is left., 8th September
item.description:
Hello I sent a case 8134867 at the beginning of the month. The tree was cut at the corner of Hope park and belcroft close. Why? They left a piece of the tronc. It was ‘perfectly healthy, provided shade and absorbed rain water. Could you follow up with my request of the above case which somehow I cannot access for giving more info. I would like to know how this was allowed to happen please . Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belcroft Close, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: UKPN manhole cover loose and noisy, 8th September
item.description:
UKPN manhole cover loose and noisy. They temporarily fixed it last year but now worse than ever. Affects residents in neighbouring building. On Bloomfield Place (next to New Bond Street) just outside a red brick building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135-137, New Bond Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Part of the road close to the drain has sunk., 8th September
item.description:

item.title: Debris on grass by Exbury House, 8th September
item.description:

item.title: Pedestrian crossings Shaftesbury/St Giles, 8th September
item.description:
All throughout the day and evenings, the pedestrian crossings still have vehicles moving across them whilst on the green pedestrian signal. The crossings often only clear once the walk signal has finished. I see this causing safety issues all the time, with peoples and vehicles moving across them at the same time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-13, St Giles High Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
